body_content.explanation: an occasion when someone appears in public:
examples: It was his first appearance on television/television appearance as president.
She will be making a public appearance, signing copies of her latest novel.

body_content.explanation: an occasion when someone goes to court to be officially involved in a trial:
examples: This was the defendant's third court appearance for the same offence.

body_content.explanation: a public performance by an entertainer:
examples: He made his first stage/TV appearance at the age of six.

body_content.explanation: to be present somewhere for a short time:
examples: I didn't really want to go to the party, but I thought I'd better put in an appearance.

body_content.explanation: the way a person or thing looks to other people:
examples: a middle-aged man of smart appearance
You can alter/change the whole appearance of a room just by lighting it in a certain way.
There was nothing unusual about/in her physical appearance.
The large car outside the house gave the appearance of wealth (= suggested wealthy people lived there).

body_content.explanation: what things look like or seem to be rather than what they actually are:
examples: He was a far more complicated man than outward appearances suggested.

body_content.explanation: judging from what can be seen:
examples: To all appearances their marriage is fine, but I think she gives him a bad time in private.
